alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 2:09PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Grafton and northeastern Carroll Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 209 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Tamworth, or 10 miles west of Conway, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Conway, Tamworth, Sandwich, Bartlett, Madison, Jackson, Albany, Eaton, Chatham, Livermore, Waterville Valley and Hart`s Location. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern New Hampshire.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos
